data.title: scss linter does not support mixin keyword arguments
Join lines should be comment block aware

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Join lines should be comment aware, and remove leading comment text from joined line.
For me specifically, this is very useful as applied to javascript jsdoc style comments, as they have a leading '*'.  I suspect this applies equally to other lanagues with similar doc comments (c#, java, etc)

### Comment   

```javascript
//Line 1
//Line 2
```
Joined
```javascript
//Line 1 Line 2
```

### Comment block   

```javascript
/** Function description
 * @param arg1 {string} blah
 *    blah blah
 * @param arg2 {Object}
 */
```
Join arg1 lines
```javascript
/** Function description
 * @param arg1 {string} blah blah blah
 * @param arg2 {Object}
 */
```

data.title: Switch to Unsaved Tab When Prompting to Save
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any file in VSCode (We will call this tab A)
2. Create new untitled tab and make changes but do not save (We will call this tab B)
3. Switch back to tab A
4. Right click tab A select close others

I think the 'Do you want to save the changes you made to Untitled-1?' should switch to the appropriate tab (in this case tab B) to show the user the contents before they decide to delete them forever.

- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-53-generic

|Extension|Author|Version|

|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.3.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.7.1|
|vscode-guid|heaths|1.0.0|
|docomment|k--kato|0.0.9|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.2.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.8.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.4.1|
|view-in-browser|qinjia|0.0.3|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|
|yo|samverschueren|0.9.3|
|MDTools|seanmcbreen|1.0.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open File -> Preferences -> Keyboard Shortcuts
2. Set focus on default key bindings
3. Search for *editor.action.formatDocument*

As you can see on Windows the key is **shift+alt+f** while on Linux it is **ctrl+shift+i**

Please make the default keybinding for both systems the same.

data.title: Hot-Exit: works only if there is one instance (window) of VS Code open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider (also reproducible in 1.8.0)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code anywhere, create new file, write something but don't save
2. Open another VS Code window ( Ctrl+Shift+N ), create new file, write something but don't save
3. Close either window

The expected behavior would be for the hot-exit feature to kick in and not to display the file-save prompt.
I'm not sure if this is a bug or a missing feature.

Well, probably a more common and practical use case would be to open two folders into separate VS Code windows.

data.title: workbench.editor.showTabs does not show tabs anymore
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra (10.12.1)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open VS Code
2. open a project
3. open a new window (⇧ ⌘ + N)

You can see that the window opens as a new window, not as a new tab in the workbench.
Changing the `workbench.editor.showTabs` seems to have no effect whatsoever.

data.title: Support for choices in snippets
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.9.0-insider
Commit 32222e2eefc7a0afe9a1a0ecb4794119efd9bc81
Date 2016-12-16T07:18:07.856Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:

Ubuntu 14.04

Currently there is no way to specify a simple choices in the templates which makes developers life easy when expanding templates

For eg.,

For bootstrap buttons, there are almost 6 types. If we need to support templates for bootstrap button, we need to add either 6 templates/a single template with the template variable class's default value as

`
<button class="btn btn-${1:default|primary|secondary|info|warning|danger}">$2</button>
`

While selecting this template, the user needs to delete the complete selection & type the required choice/selectively delete portions of this default value.

Instead, if snippets consider any value with pipe`|` separators to be choice & display a dropdown, then the user just need to use his up & down arrows in the keyboard/mouse click to select the actual choice.

This will improve the user experience for expanding templates significantly & improve developer productivity.

vscode-svgviewer - Version :1.3.0 

[CPU-20161220T164825.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/663974/CPU-20161220T164825.zip)

While working in horizontal split mode with two files opened in each pane, at random times, VS code begins to slow down while typing fast, adding new lines, copy/paste, saving, switching tabs etc.

Upon removal of the second pane and getting back to one pane/one tab view everything is running snappy and smoothly.

Git is listening for file changes.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a web project in VS Code with two large HTML/CSS files in two horizontal panes
2. Observe performance degradation while working further and further

data.title: Files in "files.exclude" are still appearing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Set files.exclude to ignore .pyc files 
```
      "files.exclude": {
        ".vscode/": true,
        "**/._*": true,
        "*.pyc": true
    },
```

2.  Run a python program to generate the pyc files and see if they appear in the file side bar.

I have tried setting the files.exclude setting in both user and workspace setting and the files still appear. It worked before the most recent update.

data.title: Quick fix light bulb disappears before it can be clicked
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file which triggers a quick fix light bulb
2. Hover the mouse over the light bulb
3. Before you click, the light bulb disappears and switches to a breakpoint icon

Filing this on behalf of @wsmelton who filed the issue originally here: https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/392

Sometimes the quick fix light bulb isn't clickable in the gutter:

![quickfixissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11204251/21283288/ae28cb00-c3c5-11e6-8a50-7dcc441503bb.gif)

It seems there may be some conflict between the hover handlers of the breakpoint gutter and the lightbulb that should be showing up.  Using <kbd>Ctrl+.</kbd> on the line invokes the quick fix menu correctly even though the lightbulb isn't clickable.

data.title: UX about inline traffic light
data.body:
I'm thinking about picking up #12628, but would like to get some input from the UX team, so we can get the design right.

## Current State

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/49038/20053382/88475732-a4d8-11e6-97aa-80eb257c5264.png)

However, this design doesn't work when activitybar is hidden or in the right.

## Electron's limitation

Electron allows one of the four following styles, but they can't be changed at runtime. Would need a restart of VSCode to use another style.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/21313907/4580a386-c62f-11e6-9984-a08284442a28.png)

## Points of Discussion

### To make the inline traffic lights work, there are three options:

1. When inlining traffic lights into activitybar, lock activitybar so user can't hide it or move it to the right.

2. Tweak the sidebar and tabbar, so they could contain the traffic lights. Chrome-style tabbar is achievable:

    ![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/19407942/0deedfac-92b1-11e6-9a5c-ae38a3a3b28b.png)

    **but I can't find a good way to let sidebar contain traffic lights**. Haven't seen other OS X app putting traffic light in sidebar either.

3. Instead of inlining traffic lights into activitybar, we inline the traffic lights into a **custom titlebar**. This is how many macOS apps are designed, like Mail, iTunes and Safari:

    ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/21311564/c7c6dc32-c622-11e6-83f5-8f4188b85805.png)

1 is easy to implement. 3 feels right design-wise. 2 probably isn't worth pursuing, as it involves a lot effort for a not-so-good design.

### Do we also add such a feature for Windows?

- If so, I think inlining traffic lights into custom titlebar is better, as the "traffic lights" are to the right in Windows. Borrowing @be5invis's mockups...

    This looks natural:

    ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/21310986/f094e698-c61f-11e6-978c-7457d924e882.png)

    Whereas this one looks odd, and doesn't account for the case when both activitybar and sidebar are hidden. It also leaves no space for menu items.

    ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/21311076/4dc9b8d4-c620-11e6-920d-a48a96eb90b2.png)

## My thoughts

Overall, I feel 3 is better than 1 in terms of usability and cross-platform design consistency.

It seems @bpasero already made a custom titlebar for macOS. If we choose design 3, I can try to make `titleBarStyle: custom` for Windows. If we choose to push the original idea forward, I want to get some input from the UX team for the usability concerns.

/cc @bpasero @stevencl @bgashler1

data.title: Has OutputEvent changed in VSCode 1.8?
Unsaved changes for freshly opened files (nothing was changed)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|vscode-theme-onedark|akamud|0.2.14|
|aurelia|AureliaEffect|0.1.12|
|Aurelia|behzad88|1.1.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|

---

I was unable to produce a reliably reproducable set of steps. It happens for some files in my project, not all. After saving them, they also show up as 'changed' in Git, but when doing a diff on the two, no changes are present. When I try stage the file, the file no longer appears as 'changed' in Git. When I open it again in VSCode, it has unsaved changes again.

I need some guidance in providing you with useful information, for I failed to find anything useful.
